thread.title: No free data from April 1: Twitter wonders if Mukesh Ambani can keep 100 million Jio users happy
thread.title_full: No free data from April 1: Twitter wonders if Mukesh Ambani can keep 100 million Jio users happy

title: No free data from April 1: Twitter wonders if Mukesh Ambani can keep 100 million Jio users happy
text: No free data from April 1: Twitter wonders if Mukesh Ambani can keep 100 million Jio users happy 'There's nothing called unconditional love.' 11310 DailyBite There's no such thing as a free lunch. While Reliance Jio chairman Mukesh Ambani announced the new tariff plans amid much fanfare, the biggest challenge will be whether Jio can retain its users once the "free" euphoria ends. A section on Twitter is always sulking. Mukesh Ambani must be happy. #Jio crosses 100m mark in 6 months. Challenge is how many will stay once 'free offer' days get over!! pic.twitter.com/AvFwzktzvh â€” hum_bolega (@hum_bolega) February 21, 2017 Well, our love for everything that comes for free. Precisely which law has been amended that allows #RelianceJio to continue #HAPPYNEWYEAR offer to existing customers ?Have I misunderstood ? â€” Anand Sivashankar (@ggmarquez) February 21, 2017 There's nothing called Unconditional LoveğŸ’”Everything in this world has a price ğŸ˜”ğŸ˜” So does #jio ....ğŸ˜ğŸ˜ğŸ˜ â€” Sathyan Ramasamy (@SathyanRamasamy) February 21, 2017 #Jio offer for #Jioprime members seems good but in practical it's waste of time and money. â€” Shubham Kumar (@ShubhamKumarS9) February 21, 2017 #Patanjali & #Jio r the two bright example how free & nationalism r good for business; as they now controls Billon indians mind & Ideology !
